meanings.definition: A store where goods are pawned or sold.
meanings.sent1: I visited the hockshop to sell my old jewelry.
meanings.sent2: People often go to the hockshop when they need quick cash.
meanings.sent3: The hockshop owner joked that he had more jewelry than a queen.
meanings.sent4: Her room looked like a hockshop with all the items scattered around.
meanings.sent5: The hockshop smelled of old leather and dust, a mix of history and neglect.

meanings.definition: To pawn or sell goods at a hockshop.
meanings.sent1: She decided to hockshop her guitar to pay for the repairs.
meanings.sent2: When times were tough, he would hockshop his watch for some extra money.
meanings.sent3: He hockshopped his old books, hoping they would find new readers.
meanings.sent4: The idea of hockshopping her memories made her feel uneasy.
meanings.sent5: In his dream, he hockshopped his worries away, one by one.
